attributes.comment:
My wife and I are in the middle of an international adoption from China. We have
long read about legislation to try to extend the time period with which our USCIS
I-171H and fingerprints would be valid for while we were in the "waiting period" for
our match with a child. Not only has that legislation not moved at all during the
last 14 months that we have been tracking it, now I am learning that not only am I
going to have to re-pay to have the exact same service provided due to your
inadequate expiration dates, but now I am going to have to possibly pay even
more! I understand these fees are proposed to go to:

N-600 fee will go from $255 to $420
*I-600A Petition to Classify Orphan as an Immediate Relative fee will go from $545
to $670
*N-565 Application for Replacement of Certificate of Citizenship (used for name
changes) will go from $220 to$380
*Biometric Services (fingerprints) will go from $70 per person to $80 per person

Why can't you find a way to set up a different set of rules that HELP people who
are trying to help a child through an international adoption versus taking more
money from us?! We are all spending tens of thousands of dollars for the right
and priviledge to serve as parents to these very needy children and for many this
is a financial challenge to do so. Increases in the fees and choosing not to pass
legislature to extend the expiration date on these previously completed processes
only hurts the children who we all so desperately want to help.

Please reconsider or consider a way to ammend the proposal to accomodate
those families who are in the middle of an international adoption?

Regards,

Vince & Kara Ranieri
Zionsville, Indiana

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Vincent Ranieri
